item.title: See Positive Backdrop For Credit: BNP Paribas' Robson
item.description: BNP Paribas Head of US Credit Strategy Meghan Robson sees positive backdrop for credit. Citi Head of Debt Capital Markets Richard Zogheb would like to see M&A pickup. They speak with Vonnie Quinn

item.title: Behind China ‘Credit Paradox,’ BNP Finds Flickers of Improvement
item.description: China is succumbing to a lending slowdown even as signs emerge of better market liquidity, a “credit paradox” that BNP Paribas Asset Management believes masks an improvement in confidence and financin

item.title: Goldman, BNP See Room for Three More South Africa Rate Cuts
item.description: South Africa’s tame inflation has created room for the central bank to cut interest rates at least three more times, according to economists.

item.title: Goldman, BNP See Room for Three More South Africa Rate Cuts
item.description: South Africa’s tame inflation has created room for the central bank to cut interest rates at least three more times, according to economists.

item.title: Wall Street’s Prime Brokerage Boom Lures European Rivals
item.description: The industry’s revenue from prime brokerage is expected to hit a record $30.8 billion this year and European banks are hustling to get a bigger piece of that action.

item.title: Wall Street’s Prime Brokerage Boom Lures European Rivals

item.title: Surprised By Amount of Dry Powder: BNP's Hjort
item.description: BNP Paribas Global Head of Credit Strategy and Desks Analyst Viktor Hjort speaks with Sonali Basak on “Real Yield.” (Source: Bloomberg)
